Text: …you just ran out of time.

Text: …knowing that tonight, we put to rest one of Gotham’s most heinous and relentless killers - Julian Gregory Day.

Text: Suspect identified as Black Mask. Repeat: code 10, suspect is Black Mask. All units at Blackgate. Code 6. Code 6. Commissioner Loeb being held captive. Repeat. Commissioner Loeb is 701.

Text: You do realize it is Christmas Eve, sir?

Text: Who tore this place apart?

Text: I don’t know what it is - it’s huge.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Where is Black Mask?

Speaker: Warden Joseph
Text: I - I don’t know. He’s here for Commissioner Loeb. Maybe one of his men knows where he’s headed.
[Batman leaves and after a few moments sees several scumbags, freely walking around the prison.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: These are Black Mask’s men. I’ll make them tell me where I can find Black Mask.

Text: What is that thing!?

Text: It’s - it’s the bat!

Text: I heard he was a myth!

Text: I don’t have time for this.

[He encounters a bunch of criminals.]

Text: We’re outta here!

Text: Move - before the guards find out.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Crap.

Text: Oh no – it’s…

Text: What is that?

Text: - ’cause they’re LINED with MY money. And what have I got to show for it? My own men in the Slammer? Not no more. No. Tonight - we’re making some changes. Some big changes.

Text: You’re a dead man walking Loeb!

Text: You heard the man. Tonight’s our night!!!

Text: That’s right. He’s gonna kill Loeb tonight!

Text: Oh Madonna Mi! (Oh mother!]

Text: We gotta try!?

Text: The memory card is damaged, but I should be able to recover most of the data back at the Batcave.

Text: Thought I caught your scent.

Text: At least we know he won’t be ugly.

Text: Freeze!

Text: Not tonight.

Text: No. It’s going to be a long night. Alfred. I just ran into a human-shaped crocodile - who told me Black Mask has hired assassins to kill me.

Speaker: Batman
Text: That’s right.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: And you heard this from the mouth of a crocodile man?

Text: His name is Killer Croc. And he’s already behind bars.

Text: Whoah… I pity his cell mate.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Let’s see what else is on the drone’s hard drive.

Speaker: Black Mask
Text: Each of them gets one of these envelopes. I need them delivered – tonight!

Speaker: Batman
Text: They’re all hired killers - the best in the business. Black Mask isn’t messing around. Slade Wilson… Deathstroke. Former military, subject of failed medical experiment.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Failed, you say?

Speaker: Batman
Text: Garfield Lynns, a.k.a. Fireﬂy. Burns on 90 percent of his body. Hmm… his obsession is going to be his end.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: How unlike anyone I know.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Here’s a face I don’t recognize… Copperhead. Strange. These reports reference a male, not a female.

Text: Fourteen escapes, huh? Well you won’t be getting out of - What the - ? Help! Help!

Speaker: Batman
Text: Floyd Lawton. AKA Deadshot.

Speaker: Policemen
Text: Freeze!

Speaker: Batman
Text: Says here he’s an expert sharpshooter.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: How on earth…?

Text: Suspected of many assassinations. Dangerous - but reckless. Street tough named Lester Buchinsky. Calls himself ‘Electrocutioner.’

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Shocking.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Shiva. Her skill is unmatched. Bane. Here - in Gotham? Why would he be taking money as a hired killer?

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Is that Warden Joseph?

Speaker: Batman
Text: Mmm-hmm. Must be how Black Mask got inside Blackgate Prison. He uses torture for intimidation - and entertainment.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Eight assassins after your head. What are you going to do?

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m going to fund out who was operating this drone - and make them tell me what they know. Then I’m going to find Black Mask - and put an end to this.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Sir - I may be stating the obvious here - but you do realize that since you and I are the only people who know the Batman’s true identity, those assassins will all fall their mandate if you’d just spend the evening here.

Speaker: Batman
Text: They’ll put innocents in danger to attract my attention. I can’t take that risk.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: And you think it’s a better idea to just put yourself in their crosshairs?

Speaker: Batman
Text: There’s only one person in Gotham who can get his hands on something like this. The Penguin. He’s been tracking Black Mask. According to the drone’s GPS, it’s next waypoint was a rendezvous with Penguin’s men at Jezebel Plaza.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: You sure this is wise, Sir?

Speaker: Batman
Text: I know what I’m doing.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Well in case you change your mind, and want to train tonight Instead I’ll keep your training facility active. Sir - make your travels easier, I went ahead and set up some auto-nav points at different areas of the city. One of my present destination should take you right to Jezebel Plaza.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Alfred. I’ve got…

Speaker: Alfred
Text: I’m tracking it, too. It appears the control towers you use for your auto-nav-systems are putting out a jamming signal.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Storm damage?

Speaker: Alfred
Text: You’ll have to go down there and find that out for yourself, Sir.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Got it. I’m close to one now.

Text: I swear - we’re the only ones here. Look - Gotham Optics gets a call that the towers acting funny, right? So they send a guy over. But he never shows. Probably went home for the night, lazy bastard… Anyway - when he doesn’t report in, they send us over. There’s no secret plan here, fellas. We’re just doing our jobs.

Text: What - the? Grab the hostages!

Speaker: Mobster
Text: Y-you seein’ this?

Text: What the hell is it?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I ain’t messin’ around. Move it!

Text: I should use my smoke pellets.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Come on. Where are you?

Speaker: Batman
Text: I need to get up and out of danger. He can’t shoot what he can’t see.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Go this side covered.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Attacking head on is a good way to get myself shot, and probably the hostage too. But they won’t expect an attack from above. Nobody ever does.

Speaker: Mobster
Text: Is that thing out there with you!?

Speaker: Hostage
Text: Are you crazy?! We were answering a service call! That’s it!

Speaker: Mobster
Text: You better not be lying to me…

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Get off me!

Speaker: Hostage
Text: Screw this! I quit!

Speaker: Mobster
Text: W-what the hell was that?! You think it’s the guy that hired us? You piss him on or something?

Text: Get yourself to safety - and call the police. They’ll want to see what’s going on here.

Speaker: Hostage
Text: OK. I will.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: If I go. I’m takin’ the hostage with me!

Speaker: Hostage
Text: T-this was just supposed to be a service call. Fix the tower. In and out. I need a new job…

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Whoever you are - come near me and I’ll kill this guy I ain’t playin’.

Speaker: Hostage
Text: I can fix the tower - Whatever you want. Just please don’t hurt me.

Speaker: Batman
Text: All I want is for you to get yourself to safety. I don’t think this tower malfunction is storm damage. I need to set up a crime scene and find out that happened. I should start by identifying the victim.
[He scans the body.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Victim’s name is David Shannon, a Gotham Optics employee sent here to repair a faulty network tower. But what killed him? Scanning the DNA impact on the wall should provide an answer.
[He scans the DNA.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Impact analysis indicates the victim was killed by some kind of explosion, originating at that access panel. I should scan it for additional clues.
[He scans the access panel.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: It looks like the panel was rigged to detonate when swiped with a keycard. Someone really didn’t want this tower repaired. And It looks like that same someone left a set of fingerprints behind.  Alfred. I’m uploading some prints for analysis. Let me know what comes back.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Certainly, sir. Searching now… And here we are: They belong to one John F. Baker. He’s a rather unremarkable criminal. Small jobs, mostly. Only… That’s curious.

Speaker: Batman
Text: What’s curious?

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Mister Baker’s dead, sir. His body was recovered from the Diamond District just under an hour ago.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Looks like someone’s tying up loose ends. I can bypass the booby-trapped access panel with my Cryptographic Sequencer. But I’ll need the encryption codes from the victim’s access card. Reviewing the crime scene will show me where it is.
[He finds the keycard.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: This card has the codes I need to hack any of the network tower’s access panels.  Alfred. Contact the GCPD. Let them know about the body. Send the data from my analysis too.

Text: Certainly, sir. Does this mean you’ve found the source of the disturbance?

Text: I think so.

Text: Who is this?

Text: Think of me as a great big mystery! One you’re never going to solve.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Enigma, then.

Text: Oh ho ho. You must think you’re so clever. Well how’s this for clever: I’ve taken control of towers all over the City. As long as they’re active, your Batwing’s useless. Speaker: Enigma
Text: Hmmm… Black Mask’s not going to like this.

Speaker: Batman
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Enigma
Text: Wouldn’t you like to know.

Text: With the jammer offline I can travel here with the Batwing. Those relays are distributed security system. I wonder what they’re protecting… That must be there Enigma’s set up shop. I need to pay him a visit.

Text: I see you’ve regained control of the Batwing, sir. I suppose it’s off to Jezebel Plaza, then?

Speaker: Batman
Text: That’s the plan. But then… I’ve also got a lead on Enigma.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Don’t overthink it too much, sir. We both know you’ll eventually wind up doing both.

Speaker: Batman
Text: If I don’t get to Jezebel Plaza before that arms dealer, I’ll have no way to locate the Penguin.

Text: This is a long bridge. I should use my Grapnel Accelerator.

Text: I hope you will try to keep a low profile tonight, sir.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Trust me. I’ll take out those assassins before they even know I’m there.

Text: It’s not just that. If some curious child looks out to see who’s pattering across their rooftop they expect Santa Claus, not a black-clad, bat-creature.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I don’t patter.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Looks like I’m the first one here. I need to find a spot where I can stake this place out unnoticed. Penguin. Not a dime changes hands in this city he can’t tell you about. Text: Guys! So, little boys - what do you want for Christmas? Oh wait. I already know. Now let’s see if you’ve been naughty or… Nice.

Text: Punk in the Santa Hat must be in charge.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Where’s the rest of ‘em?

Text: What the crap?

Text: You’re crazy! You’re friggin’ crazy!

Text: If I can read this SIM card. I may be able to locate Penguin.

Text: Alfred, I getting interference on my com systems. Is that on your side?

Text: No, sir. I’m seeing it as well. It’s from the nearby GCR tower. It’s the same signal jamming the Batwing’s auto-nav systems. I’ve highlighted the tower on your map.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’ll need to stop that signal before I can track down the Penguin.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I’m just happy to have work right now.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: But don’t you think it’s weird? We’ve never seen this guy or heard his voice? Nothin’ but texts from an unlisted number.

Text: Whaddo I care - long as the money shows up in my bank account.

Text: Well look who just showed up! Have you really decided to try and take me on? Get to it. Then I’m looking forward to watching you fall.

Speaker: Enigma
Text: You know, if you’d asked nicely, I’d of opened It for you.

Speaker: Enigma
Text: Congratulations are in order! Maybe you’re not as stupid as I’ve been led to believe.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Why are you doing this, Enigma?

Text: Direct! I like it. So I’ll tell you. Gotham is sullied. It’s filled with brutes who control this city through violence and intimidation.

Speaker: Batman
Text: You didn’t answer my question.

Speaker: Enigma
Text: Because you didn’t let me finish! I want to get rid of them, Batman. To improve Gotham’s intellectual and moral standing. But I’m not a thug like you. My approach is a bit more refined.

Text: What you’re doing is no different than stealing. There’s nothing refined about it.

Speaker: Enigma
Text: Your response IS as predictable as it is banal. Goodbye.

Text: Now I can access the SIM card I took from that arms dealer and hack Penguin’s communications.

Text: The Penguin’s pretty pissed off about the deal going 800th.

Text: Yeah - if I was involved in that. I’d be on my way out of the city.

Text: Ah yes. I see it here. Looks like Penguin runs his own private wireless network using laptop transmitters serving as ad hoc com stations. He’s feeding his men frequencies via two-way radio. There are two of these com stations near your position.

Text: Good. Mark them on my map. It loan find and hack those walkie-talkles I can triangulate Penguin’s position.

Text: I start my trainin’ tomorrow. Gonna kick ass in next year’s Boiler Deck.

Text: Mr. Cobblepot. I swear it was the Bat. He dropped Ricky off the roof of the clock tower straight into the Christmas tree.

Text: Yes, Mr. Cobblepot. I’m sorry, Mr. Cobblepot.

Text: There you are. Onboard the Final Offer.

Text: Penguin’s been hiding out on an old ship. No wonder he’s been so hard to find.

Text: I need any unassigned unit for special assignment. Stand by.

Text: Penguin’s got snipers out. I’ll have to take the snipers down silently to proceed.

Text: So, who’s the outside challenger this year?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Some guy… Buchinsky?

Text: Welcome to Blackgate. We’re just going to do a quick psychiatric evaluation. Bad day, huh? Cops in this city - always beating on the sick and defenseless.

Speaker: Joker
Text: Tell me something, dear - have *you* ever had a really bad day?
[We enter the world of Joker’s mind.]

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: And what do you mean by that?

Speaker: Joker
Text: You of all people should know there’s nothing so CRUEL as MEMORY. The pointy, bitey little THUNDERBOLTS. Unwanted party crashers, SCREAMERS through your synapses. Inescapable, unrelenting… not at all friendly. You can’t even escape into MADNESS! And then you meet someone who changes your life. And you feel that you don’t even know who you are any more. Isn’t it funny how one little encounter can CLEAVE off little pieces of your past. DEFORM your memories and persona until you rethink your whole identity - and as you realize how foolish it all is - your LAUGHTER reverberates off the walls of your own emptiness.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: Ohhhkaayyy… I’m going to need more specifics. How about we try some word association?

Speaker: Joker
Text: That sounds… delightful.

Speaker: Joker
Text: Now that’s a little trite, isn’t it?

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: Look… I’m only doing this to help you. Let’s try this again. Acceptance.

Speaker: Joker
Text: My favorite stage.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: O.K. One more. And I need you to be serious for this one. Fate.

Speaker: Joker
Text: You want to know something funny? I used to think of Fate as EVIL - predetermined - not by some higher power, but by the rules of human NATURE. But tonight, that’s all changed.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: What’s changed?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Have you ever had the feeling that your entire life has been building towards this one moment?

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: Is that how you feel?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Well now, yes. Now I realize that all the BATTLES, the BAD DAYS, the BRUTALITIES - it was all the hand of Fate at work.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: So now you see fate differently?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Absolutely. Now I understand. There are no chance encounters. It was all meant to be. Everything leading up to who I’ve met tonight!

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: So you’ve met someone special?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Yes. And you might say it’s changed EVERYTHING.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: Everything?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Absolutely. I mean, do you realize what a vile world we live in? How lonely it is to wade through all the wrath and filth on your own?

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: It is kind of lonely, isn’t it?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Of course. Of course! You understand! Even in a crowd of other screwballs, you’re so alone that you can kick, claw, yell, scream at the top of your lungs - and no one cares. It’s like you don’t even exist. I feel…

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: And how does that make you feel?

Speaker: Joker
Text: I feel adrift - ﬂoating - like someone’s pulled the stopper on my reality and I’m SUCKED down the drain Into something new. It’s all very exciting really. You wouldn’t know what that feels like, I’m sure.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: I - might… actually. Can you tell me more about how this person makes you feel?

Speaker: Joker
Text: It’s like meeting someone I can actually relate to which, believe me, dear. I’ve NEVER felt before. You understand. You’re someone who’s not afraid to let go and fall. Free falling. And I didn’t pack a chute. Do you know what I mean?

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: Yes. Yes, I do.

Speaker: Joker
Text: I figured you would.

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: So… may I ask - who is this person?

Speaker: Joker
Text: Someone very, very special, but whose real name I don’t even know yet!

Speaker: Psychologist
Text: My name’s Harleen. Harleen Quinzel.

Speaker: Joker
Text: What a pretty name. Do your friends call you Harley?

Speaker: Harleen
Text: Oh, I don’t have a lot of friends.

Speaker: Joker
Text: Well, Harley, you got one now.
[Meanwhile, Batman himself is in deep thought about whether it was worth saving the Joker.]

Speaker: Joker
Text: Now… Why? Why? Why would you do that? Newsﬂash: I’m the one who’s trying to kill you.
[In his thoughts, he sees his family being killed and hear voices…]

Speaker: Thomas Wayne
Text: There’s no need for this…

Speaker: Gordon
Text: …the worst kind of criminal…

Speaker: Barbara
Text: Walt… Why do you do what you do?
[Alfred enters.]

Speaker: Arfred
Text: It fight be a bit anticlimactic. But I hoped you might finally be ready to celebrate Christmas Eve - now that the Joker’s behind bars.

Speaker: Bruce Wayne
Text: Bane is still out there. I’ve got to locate the signal from the tracker I placed on him.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Even you must eat, sir.

Speaker: Bruce Wayne
Text: If you hadn’t called the police, he’d already be in custody.
[He listens to his radio.]

Speaker: Cop
Text: Dispatch, this is Delta 47, the Ellsworth building. Confirmed. Building was under construction. Appears to have been empty. No sign of any casualties.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: You know I made a promise of my own - to your parents.

Speaker: Bruce Wayne
Text: Not now, Alfred.

Speaker: Cop
Text: What’s the story bask at the precinct?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Place’s evac’d. Found bombs under the foundation. Same kind they found at the Royal.

Speaker: Bruce Wayne
Text: Sounds like this could be Bane or one of his men. If I hurry to the GCPD morgue, I can inspect the body and the autopsy report.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Well before you leave, - I’ve run some tests on the compound you found at the Steel mill. Looks like a match for your ’globular projectile for non-lethal restraint’.

Speaker: Bruce Wayne
Text: You mean the glue grenade?

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Indeed. The resin has finished curing. It’s at your workbench. Of course. I’d recommend testing it here in the lab before you go but I’m sure you won’t listen to me. You never do. So I take it you won’t be testing it then?

Speaker: Batman
Text: It’s called field testing, Alfred.
[Batman is going to board his plane and fly away, but Alfred abruptly stops him.]

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Master Bruce. Stop, Master Bruce. BRUCE!

Speaker: Batman
Text: What are you -

Speaker: Alfred
Text: I will not in good conscience allow you to go. You’re out-matched by these assassins and -

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m what? -

Speaker: Alfred
Text: …you’re not some hardened vigilante. You’re a young man with a trust fund and too much anger. You are in over your head and I don’t want this to be your end.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Alfred, who do you see, when you look at me? The boy whose shoes you used to tie every morning, the teenager you drove to his first date? While you are here every… the ONLY THING between the innocent and the predatory.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: You may be, but -

Speaker: Batman
Text: No. Not ’may be’. I am. When the mugger or the thief stops to think twice — that is fear. That is what I am. That is why they hired assassins - because I am the reason the criminals breathe easier when the sun rises.

Speaker: Batman
Text: So, no. Alfred - I am NOT in over my head. Tonight will not be my end. But it will be theirs.
[Batman flies away.]

Speaker: Alfred
Text: I trust you realize you can’t just waltz into the GCPD after everything that’s happened there tonight.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I know I can’t do that. I’ll have to find a way in that will avoid detection.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Indeed. Look. I’m sorry about what I said before you left. I hope you understand it’s just because -

Speaker: Batman
Text: It’s OK. I understand.
[Near morgue entrance.]

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: So, you’re sayin’ Black Mask ain’t dead. An’ he ain’t the one who killed Loeb. And he ain’t in control of his gang no more.

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Nope.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: An’ some new guy in town took his gang over and did all that stuff.

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Yup.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: An’ that’s the guy who was tryin’ to blow up the station?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Yup.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: An’ he’s in Blackgate now?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Yup.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: So who’s in control of Black Mask’s gang?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: You ever shut up?

Speaker: GCPD Dispatcher
Text: All units, getting calls about a disturbance. Standby for location.
[Batman beats up the cops and enter the sewers that leads to morgue.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: I should try to use my new glue grenade to plug these pipes.
[He identify the body.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Hmm. It’s not Bane, but one of his men - the same one I saw at the riot in the precinct’s holding cells earlier. I should scan his corpse. The victim was dosed with a chemical that caused temporary deformation of his physiology. I’ll need to check the autopsy report to find out more.
[He scans the computer.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: That computer should contain the autopsy report I’m looking for. Interesting. The victim was using a powerful compound with many similarities to the street drug Venom at the time of his death. It changes the user’s muscle and bone structure, greatly enhancing strength for a temporary period. It appears that whatever this compound is, it reduces mental capacity in several ways - including severe damage to the brain’s memory center. Prolonged use could seriously compromise the user’s memory. There’s Bane’s tracker.
[He leave the morgue.]

Speaker: GCPD Dispatcher
Text: All available units - we’ve received reports of shots fired inside the Coventry Distric t. Witnesses describe two armed groups fighting over what appear to be chemical weapons. Requesting any available officers locate and secure the scene.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Chemical weapons? I should investigate.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I should hurry to Bane’s location before I lose the signal again. I need to use my Glue Grenade to make a raft.
[He find Bane’s hideout.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: My tracking device is in here somewhere – which means Bane is likely in here as well.
[He looks at Bane’s research.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Impressive work, but it looks like Bane hasn’t found a way to counter the damaging side effects this compound has on the brain’s memory centers. Some of this research is dedicated to overcoming his own addiction and dependency on venom. He can’t survive without it. Project TN-1. Looks like Bane is experimenting with a new form of venom. Whatever it is, it must be what caused the physiological changes I saw in the corpse back at the GCPD.
[He enters a room full of photos and videos of Bruce Wayne and Batman. It’s shocked him.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Alfred. Bane knows who I am. You’re not safe at Wayne Manor.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Got it. I’ll call the police!

Speaker: Batman
Text: No. I can’t risk them discovering my identity as well. Just secure yourself in the Batcave.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: What are you going to do?

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m on my way to you. I’ll… figure something out.

Speaker: GCPD Dispatcher
Text: Repeat: suspect is airborne in a jet pack, armed with a ﬂamethrower. Multiple hostages on the Pioneers bridge.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Fireﬂy. He must not Know Joker’s behind bars – and he’s putting those people in danger - to get to me.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Delta 6-5 to Dispatch. Who’s the O.I.C. at Pioneers?

Speaker: GCPD Dispatcher
Text: Captain James Gordon is the officer in charge.
[Batman leaves Bane’s Hideout.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: A lot of lives could be at risk at the bridge. If I can hack Fireﬂy’s communication channel, I can learn more.
[He hacks the channel.]

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: And if the cops try anything stupid, kill a few hostages.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Sure thing. And uh… How long before we set the timers on the bombs?

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Not until the Bat shows. We’ll wait all night if we have to. There’s Million riding on this.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Alfred - Fireﬂy has hostages on the Pioneers Bridge. I need to deal with him before coming back.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Can’t you just let the police handle Mister Lynns - especially in light of what we’ve just learned.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I can’t abandon those hostages. They’re in jeopardy because of me. Because of the bounty Joker placed on my head. You’ll be safe in the Batcave.
[He flies to the bridge.]

Speaker: Gordon
Text: This is a hostage situation people. Get into position and prepare to breach on my order. Do not provoke or engage the suspect. He’s got hostages in the bridge sublevel. Just get yourselves into position.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I need to draw Fireﬂy away from the bridge so I can approach safely.
[Cutscene. Firefly set on fire the cars on the bridge.]

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Listen up… The Bat is here. If just one of those stinking pigs sets foot on this bridge… set the timers. We’ll blow them all to hell! Wooohooo.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Gordon would never order a breach if he knew about Fireﬂy’s bombs. I’ve got to stop him before he sends his men into a trap.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Dispatch, this is Marine 4. Where’s the tactical command post? We’re supposed to report to Gordon.

Speaker: GCPD Dispatcher
Text: TCP is inside the center pillar at the base of the bridge.

Speaker: Bullock
Text: Branden’s gunnin’ for you. You can’t trust ‘em!

Speaker: Gordon
Text: He’s a cop. Harvey. He’ll do his job.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Don’t send in your men. Fireﬂy has the bridge rigged with explosives.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Show yourself.

Speaker: Branden
Text: Branden to Gordon. We’re in place, awaiting your orders.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: You have a go.

Speaker: Branden
Text: Branden to Gordon. We’re in place, awaiting your orders.

Speaker: Batman
Text: No, call them back. If Fireﬂy blows the bridge, there’s no telling how many will die.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: You’re the reason those people are in danger. He’s doing this for the bounty on your head. Give yourself up.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m going to bring in Firefly myself. Don’t send anyone else in until I tell you it’s safe.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: You’ll stay the hell out of this! You hear me?

Speaker: Branden
Text: No! Take him down!

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Branden! Branden, report!

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Captain Gordon I told you - the ONLY person I want setting foot on this bridge is the Bat Man. Test me again… and things will not got well for officer Branden, is it?

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Dammit. Anyone have eyes on Branden?

Speaker: Cop
Text: Bravo-Z. Command. That’s a negative.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: All units, maintain your positions. No one else goes in without my order.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: So let me get this straight. The bombs run on timers. Once we set ‘em, we got plenty of time to get off the bridge - right?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Yeah but… do you trust ‘em?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Who, Fireﬂy?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: No. Him. I know I don’t trust. But how do you know any of the other guys ain’t setting their timers and not tellin’ us?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I hadn’t even thought of that…

Speaker: Batman
Text: I need to make one of these guards tell me how many bombs Fireﬂy has and where they are.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: So? What’re you gonna do with your share?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Me? I’ma buy a boat.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Look at this guy - A boat!? Moron. What’d ’ou know about boats?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You can all quit your daydreamin’ My boy over in Black Mask’s crew said the bounty’s off.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: What?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Said the guy who put up the bounty’s behind bars.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Black Mask?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Nah. It’s some other guy.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Man - you’re crazy. Everyone knows Black Mask put up the bounty.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Sounds like your boy don’t even know who put up the bounty in the first place.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Believe whatever you want, i got my sources.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Yikes!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Spread out, dammit!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You gave me a freakin’ heart attack!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: It’s him! I see him! That… thing!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I see. I tear down those thing up there and that’ll cut him off.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He can’t keep hiding up her.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: No! No!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Hang on! I’m comin’!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: This guy’s been strung up like a trophy kill. Course he ain’t dead. Wait… maybe he’s comin’ back for ‘em?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Found ‘em!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He hung him upside down. Like… a bat.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I see‘em! Get your asses over here!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: AAAH!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I’m gonna wreck those things up there!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Like to see him try to perch up there now.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Hey! You okay, man? Need some help.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Dammit!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Hey! What the hell is going on!?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Head’s up! He’s close by!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You ain’t take me down!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: OK! OK! I surrender!

Speaker: Batman
Text: How many bombs are on this bridge!?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Four! Four! One here, one directly above us - in the bridge sublevel. - and one more at each end of the bridge those are the big ones. That’s all of ‘em. I promise!

Speaker: Batman
Text: And I promise you a good night’s sleep. Four bombs on the bridge - with the largest bombs at each end. I’ll need to disarm this bomb before going after the others.
[He disarms the first bomb.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: One bomb down. Now to find the other three.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Five-two, command. Our target hit a gas main with his ﬂamethrower. Fire in the north end.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Dammit. I’m remotely engaging the fire door in that section to protect the hostages.

Speaker: Branden
Text: Let me go while you still got a chance.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Got quite a mouth, officer Branden. In different circumstances - we could’a made a deal, but Firefly’s just payin’ us too well.

Speaker: Branden
Text: You idiots ain’t gonna live long enough to get paid. Fireﬂy’s got a remote detonator. He doesn’t need you to set any timers. He’s gonna blow the bombs with you on the bridge - with all of us on the bridge.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: What’s he talkin’ about?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He’s full of it. He’ll say anything to get us to let him go.

Speaker: Branden
Text: Didn’t you hear that bomb just go off?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: That explosion we just heard? That wasn’t one of the bombs. No way, no how.
[Batman beats up the criminals that holds Branden.]

Speaker: Branden
Text: Well look who it is… You just gonna stand there? Untie me.

Speaker: Batman
Text: You’ve been after the bounty on my head all night. It was never Sionis. The Joker put up the bounty and now he’s behind bars.

Speaker: Branden
Text: I heard. But I still got a score to settle with you!
[He tries to punch Batman but he easily counter it and punches Branden back.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m giving you the rest of the night off.  You took an oath to uphold the law. When I see you again I expect you to be following that oath - to the letter.

Speaker: SWAT
Text: Yes - yes sir. I’m sorry.

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: What’s the status of our explosives? What’s the status of our explosion?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Bomb’s secure uh, mister Firefly. Sir.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Fireﬂy’s locked his hostages in a train car with explosives.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Uh… Yeah. Good thinkin’. Whoa.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Need a hand here! This guy got messed up bad.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I told you to watch your back, didn’t I?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Where are you!?
[Batman saves hostages in the rigged train.]

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Bravo-2, this is command. Report.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Source of explosion was an Oil truck on the bridge surface. Massive damage. No casualties observed.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Copy. Keep me informed.

Speaker: Hostage
Text: Is… is he going to save us? There’s a control room. That’s how they raised the train up here. Lower it so we can get out!

Speaker: Batman
Text: That must be the fire door Gordon engaged. Gordon - open the fire door in the train depot so I can disarm Fireﬂy’s bomb at the north end of the bridge.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Get off this frequency. Now.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Listen - I’m on my way to disarm the bomb at the south end. Have this door open by the time I get back.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: You let me do my job and stay the hell out of my way!

Speaker: Batman
Text: Dammit. Alfred. There’s a fire door blocking my progress. I need codes to get past it.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: The police should have access to those codes. Perhaps Captain Gordon can…

Speaker: Batman
Text: Gordon won’t cooperate. I’m heading to get the other bomb. Get those codes to me by the time I’m done.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Right. I’ll do my best.
[Batman gets out and makes his way along the half-destroyed bottom of the bridge.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: This is not going to be easy.

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Let’s see you cops breach this bridge now!!! You won’t even recognize it!

Speaker: Batman
Text: I need to deal with these last two bombs before I turn my attention to Fireﬂy.

Speaker: GCPD Pilot
Text: Wait a minute - there’s someone moving around down there. Possible Batman spotting. Tracking target.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Negative. Stay to your assigned patrol. If Fireﬂy spots your target he could set off his bombs.

Speaker: GCPD Pilot
Text: Roger that.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I mean, what are we lookin’ out for? What’s sneakin’ up out here in the middle of the channel?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Oh yeah? And Santa Claus and his reindeer, too?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I’ve got him! Over here!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Get it off, get it off. GET IT OFF!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: So you heard about the Falcones?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: What ’bout ‘em?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Word on the street is the Penguin’s pushin’ ‘em outta the gun trade.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Penguin, huh? I always thought that guy was a chump.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Who’s he Penguin?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: See that’s exactly my point. No one’s even heard of his guy - and he’s messin’ with the Falcone’s?
[Batman beats them up and disarm bomb number two.]

Speaker: Batman
Text: Only one more bomb to go - on me opposite end of the bridge.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: Sir. I have those fire door codes you asked for.

Speaker: Batman
Text: OK. I’ll call you when I’m at the door.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: I also thought I’d let you know - hostages you released have escaped. They’re telling tales of a hero who saved their lives.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I’m not looking for praise, Alfred.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: I figured you’d say that. Would it kill you to lighten up a bit, sir?

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: I want to see the look on the cops’ faces when I blow this bridge into Christmas future!

Speaker: GCPD Pilot
Text: He’s burning vehicles now. Half the bridge is on fire!

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Keep your distance. Don’t provoke him.’The bomb squad is nearly here.

Speaker: Batman
Text: I need to get to that last bomb before Gordon and his men force Fireﬂy’s hand.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: If it wasn’t the cops, then who was it?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: It’s gotta be the BAT.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You sayin’ the Bat knocked these guys out, defused the bombs and released the hostages? Impossible. He’s only one guy.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: From what I hear - he’s got the strength of ten men.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Please. Don’t give me that baloney. He’s only one guy and there’s no way one guy couldda’ done all this.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You think we should radio Fireﬂy and let him know the Bat’s here?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: We don’t know the Bat’s here yet. And Fireﬂy will burn us to a crisp if we’re wrong. Let’s wait ’til we’re sure, ein?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Man. I’m sure. Who else could do this?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: I don’t know. Like the National Guard or something.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Yeah - or maybe it was Santa Claus and his army of angry reindeer. I’m tellin’ ya. It was the Bat.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Fine. You’re probably right. But let’s just look around for some proof before we go calling in Fireﬂy. That’s all I’m sayin’.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: What’s this?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Fire extinguishers don’t just explode.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He’s here! It’s the Bat!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Now yer in for it!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Everybody get over here now!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: You wanna die!?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: It’s you or me!

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Alright. All units we are breaching. Move in people.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Gordon. I’ve defused three of the four bombs. As soon as I defuse the final bomb -

Speaker: Gordon
Text: We are breaching now. You’re too late.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Alfred. Open the fire door.

Speaker: Alfred
Text: As you wish, Sir.

Speaker: GCPD Pilot
Text: Mayday! Mayday! We are goin’ down. Repeat.

Speaker: Gordon
Text: Dammit! Anyone have eyes on Air One?

Speaker: GCPD Pilot
Text: Air 2 to command. Air 1 is down, Sir. No survivors.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Fireﬂy will pay for this.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He’s here somewhere. Just gotta keep our eyes open.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: There he is! Looks like it’s gonna be a merry Christmas after all!

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Take ’im down, boys!

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Finish ’im off! Any last words, Batman? So. Batman - this is how it ends! Get ‘em boys! Save some for me, boys! Finish ’im off! How do you want to die? The quick, incinerating flash of an EXPLOSION? Or… a nice SLOW BURN?

Speaker: Batman
Text: The Joker’s behind bars. There’s no more prize money. You can give up now or I can make you surrender. Your choice.

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Don’t hate me, Batman. I just want to melt your face.

Speaker: Batman
Text: Doesn’t sound like he’s coming down here to fist fight me.

Speaker: Fireﬂy
Text: Come to the ﬂames.
